dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE a girl standing in about a foot of snow. She faces the woods. Her face is in awe. She pans the woods up and down with her eyes. She steadily starts walking further and further...and starts gaining a faster pace as the epic-ness begins. Once she's in the woods, it grows very dark. She looks back for a moment...then back around to be struck in the face by a bright light. It fades and she can see a man standing on a small hill. She walks to him.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: Jason?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be here.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: Mom and Dad want you to come home now.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: He won't let me. The boy starts to quiver. Tracy grows scared. Blood begins to run from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: No...no...no... A chain saw rips through Jason's chest. Tracy screams! WE PAN BACK to reveal a masked man standing behind him, holding the machine. 2.  Tracy still screams as her brother is being ripped up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE Tracy lying in bed...eyes wide open. She's breathing heavy. She looks around, and then sits up. She sees her roommate staring at her.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Bad dream?

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Same one?

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: Yeah, Soph, same one. Sophie drops her head...so does Tracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WEE SEE sign that reads MAIN LODGE AND DINING. Tracy and Sophie run past it in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We are going to be so late.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I know. Tracy gets up on the porch and gives her boyfriend, MIKE, a hug. The head counselor walks out, followed by another guy.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Alright everybody! Listen up. We got a lot of work ahead of us over the next few days so lock this place down for the winter. Two of the counselors hug each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I was saying. We got a lot of work over the next few days so we can lock this place down. So I arranged for an extra set of hands. He puts his hand on a guy's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So I want to you meet James. He's an old family friend.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Hey everybody.

dialogues.speaker: ELVIS
dialogues.text: What's up, man? Everyone says hey.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: James is hitching his way to USC. He's a got full scholarship no less. Everyone awes.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I roped him into sticking around for a couple days, helping us. Let's get to it. Any volunteers who want to pair up with James for the day?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Me. I will.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Okay. Nice to see your enthusiasm, Sophie. Oh, one more thing. We got some weather coming in so if you want to grab some extra blankets from the shed tonight, go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Who needs blankets?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Alright. Let's go everyone. Let's go. Everyone walks away except Ryan and Angela...they're  kissing.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ryan! Can I see you for a moment? Did you put the wood chipper back in the shed like I asked you to last night?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: I knew it.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I'll take care of it right now.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: No, it's too late. The rain last night ruined the motor.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. It won't happen again.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: It's just like the leaf blower.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: The leaf blower wasn't my fault.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: And the canoe paddles?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Look! Why are you always on my ass?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Because you're a screw-up.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: What'd you say?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: You heard me. Look, I'm not impressed by your macho bull shit like your little girlfriend. I'm going to say this one: your screw ups are costing me a lot money and I don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: So what are you going to do, Rick? Are you going to fire me, with only three days left?  Ryan walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Mike and Tracy walking to us. Tracy is carrying blankets.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: Ah, The trees are turning early this year.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yeah. So much for our Indian summer, huh?

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's kind of lonely here without all of the kids.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Do not tell me you miss them.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: It's sad. The end of summer and everything. The two help each other spread the blanket over a close line.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't you miss them?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Now that you bring it up. (pointing) Nah. They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: Come on, mister tough guy. Now you can't fool me. Inside you're just a geat big softy.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Actually, you know that kid with the lazy eye? He kind of got to me a little bit.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: They EXT. They They (laughing) See. I knew it. smile at each other.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'd like to propose a toast. all come into frame.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: To the end of camp. all toast.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: May we not have to clean up another camper's puke for another ten months.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Or Elvis'.

dialogues.speaker: ELVIS
dialogues.text: That shit is fucking nasty.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: And now that the little bastards have gone home to their mommies and daddies, we can turn our thought to more adult pursuits. Angela looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So what's tonight's mischief?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: How about a game...of (cringes) Bloody Murder?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Great idea. Who's up for it? Elvis...

dialogues.speaker: ELVIS
dialogues.text: Do I have to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be a chicken shit, you're it.

dialogues.speaker: ELVIS
dialogues.text: Who's being a chicken shit? Everyone teases him.

dialogues.speaker: ELVIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck you, okay.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: How about you Mike? You up for it?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yep, yep, yep, yep.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Tracy?

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: Actually. I think I'm going to pass.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Trace...

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: It's fine. You guys have fun.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Trace...

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: Actually I'm really tired. I'm just going to go to bed early.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I thought we were gonna...

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: Not tonight, I'm serious. You guys have fun, okay? She kisses Mike and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Let me walk you back. He leaves and follows her.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Jesus. You guys are so  insensitive.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ELVIS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Don't play innocent. You know exactly what you were doing. Mike of all people should know better.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I think I might have missed something.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Tracy's brother Jason disappeared up here about five years ago.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Disappeared?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Well, there was a series of murders that summer, and Jason's body was never found. The locals claim it was Trevor Moorehouse.

dialogues.speaker: ELVIS
dialogues.text: They claimed.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Mike and Tracy walk up to Tracy's cabin.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Tracy, that was--that was insensitive of me.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: It's okay. I'm fine--really

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I just wasn't really thinking.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: They kiss. It's okay. I didn't even mean to make a thing out of it.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Why don't you and I hang here while the others run around the woods like idiots?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you say?

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: Mike...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What if I begged?

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: Mike.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What if I cried?

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: Even if you cried.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I'm sensing you're trying to tell me no.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: Trust your senses.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I've tried really hard to get close to you this summer.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: Don't make a thing out of it.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I'm just saying I've tried so hard to be sensitive to your family situation. 10.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: My family situation? Is that really what you think of this?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I didn't mean it to sound like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you mean?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I can't get close to you. You put up this front.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: I'm tired of being treated like I've got six heads.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Then you shouldn't have told us about your brother.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I'm just saying it's a little confusing. You know, you either want the attention or you don't.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: I don't think I want to talk about this anymore. She leaves and walks inside the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: ELVIS
dialogues.text: (mumbling) That's it. Ease up... There's laughter. 11.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, you need a beer? Mike walks up to the fire where everyone else is

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Amen, brother.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Got back kind of quick.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Looks like somebody's not getting any tonight.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yeah. What else is new, man?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: James has been asking about Trevor Moorehouse.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Fuck him. That guy's putting a serious dent in my sex life.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Who was he?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Somebody else tell that story.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Trevor was the son of the meanest camp director that Placid Pines has ever seen. He had this habit of ratting on the counselors to his old man. Well, one year...several of the counselors got this half-assed plan to get back at them. But things got out of control, and before they knew it, Trevor was at the bottom of a ravine half dead with his face eaten by hungry birds.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What happened to him?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Well, naturally... 12.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Naturally, he went to the hospital. Medical at first, then mental. His face was so badly disfigured that he always wore a mask.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, how did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every summer camp has a Trevor Moorehouse. Here, let me see. At some point he was either released, or he broke out of the mental hospital. Then it's said that he returned to Camp Placid Pines to forever seek out his revenge on the place and the people...that did this to him. How'd I do?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Smart ass.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Set up the new guy, huh? Nice try, boys. Trevor Moorehouse is just some fictitious local psychopath to get campers into bed at night.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Fictitious local psychopath?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Did you really think I'd be stupid enough to fall for that?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: You think I'm making it up?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I hope not. I would think you'd be able to come up with something a little better than the old Гўв‚¬Е“psychopath in the woods" story.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Well then, tough guy. Since you've got nothing to fear you won't mind being "It." They all laugh. 13.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay sports fans. It's time for a little game of -- Angela jumps up to Ryan, hugging.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Bloody Murder.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Angela, do the honors. He hands her a blindfold.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Of course. She walks over to James with it.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. I didn't say anything --

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: What's the matter, Jimbo? Huh? You having a little change of heart?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Scared?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: You afraid Trevor might break up the game?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: No. I just don't feel --

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Good! Then let the pretty lady blindfold you. Remember...there's nothing to fear.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: But fear itself.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Let the games begin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group walks to a big tree in the middle of the woods. James is blindfolded.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: You've got to count to 20 before you can remove the blindfold.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody ready?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Go! The group runs off to hide.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: One-one thousand. Two-one thousand. Three-one thousand. Four-one thousand. Five-one thousand...eighteen-one thousand. Nineteen-one thousand. Twenty-one thousand. He turns around and removes the blindfold. He looks around. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, man. Me and my big mouth. James walks off to search for the rest of the group. Each of the people are hiding in a different location. James backs up into a tree and gasps.

dialogues.speaker: ELVIS
dialogues.text: (peeking through trees) You're not in Compton anymore. James sees Mike gagging by a tree, back to him. Mike turns around. His neck is bloody as he holds it. He spits up blood. James begins to back up. 15.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Oh-oh-oh! James turns around in horror. There's a hockey-masked figure with an axe coming up behind James.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Trevor -- Trevor Moorehouse! He screams as the masked man yells with the axe in the air. The yelling turns into laughter.  Mike is okay, and the man removes his mask. It is Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (laughing) You were saying something about fictitious local psychopaths?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: We got him.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Amen, brother.

dialogues.speaker: ELVIS
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: We're just having a little fun at James' expense.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Tell him about the psychopath, then they come out dressed -- that's hot, baby.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: That was beautiful with the blood.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (pretend crying) Trevor Moorehouse! Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Rick was right about you. James begins to walk away. 16.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, what's that?!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You are an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I said you're an asshole. Ryan tackles James to the ground. Ryan falls first though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, man.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Break it up, guys! They restrain Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: You're dead, you little fucker! Don't fuck with me! Fuck you, bitch.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (pointing) Get your little friend out of here before he gets hurt.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Easy! They all runs back to the cabin except for James and Sophie.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Yeah. He's not the first asshole I've had to deal with. He certainly won't be the last.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: I'm gonna head back up, but I'll see you in the morning. 17.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Yeah, if I decide to stay.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Don't let that loser get to you.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: We'll see.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Good night.  Sophie walks back to the camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James sits there by himself.
